meanings.definition: To entertain or provide enjoyment to someone.
meanings.sent1: The clown will amuse the children at the birthday party.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's jokes never fail to amuse the audience.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy tried to amuse the sleepy cat by chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The colorful puppet show will amuse both young and old alike.
meanings.sent5: The magician's tricks never cease to amuse and delight the crowd.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to laugh or smile.
meanings.sent1: The funny movie never fails to amuse my little sister.
meanings.sent2: The silly jokes shared between friends always amuse them.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey tried to amuse the zoo visitors by making faces.
meanings.sent4: The comedian's witty remarks never fail to amuse the audience.
meanings.sent5: The hilarious meme circulating online continues to amuse everyone who sees it.

meanings.definition: To occupy someone's attention in a pleasant way.
meanings.sent1: The colorful picture book will amuse the children for hours.
meanings.sent2: The engaging story never fails to amuse the readers.
meanings.sent3: The clever riddle was meant to amuse the guests at the party.
meanings.sent4: The intricate puzzle game will amuse and challenge players of all ages.
meanings.sent5: The fascinating documentary on wildlife will amuse and educate viewers at the same time.
